intro: Vitex pobeguinii, commonly known as the Madagascar vitex, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or limestone habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
